title:
Instructions
Thinly slice the meat, if not pre-sliced. Mix all marinade ingredients well. Combine the meat, onion, and scallions with the marinade and mix well. Marinate for about an hour. Grill over charcoal or pan fry in a skillet over medium high heat until slightly caramelized. (Preheat and lightly oil with sesame oil before adding the meat. If pan frying, do not crowd the skillet. Adjust the heat as necessary.)
directions: Jeyuk Bokkeum (or Dweji Bulgogi) - Spicy Pork BBQ
Spicy Korean pork bulgogi marinated in a gochujang based sauce with lots of fresh garlic and ginger!
2 pounds thinly sliced pork shoulder see bulgogi recipe for slicing tips
6 tablespoons gochujang Korean chili pepper paste
1 tablespoon gochugaru Korean chili pepper flakes
ingredients: Jeyuk Bokkeum (or Dweji Bulgogi) - Spicy Pork BBQ
Spicy Korean pork bulgogi marinated in a gochujang based sauce with lots of fresh garlic and ginger!
2 pounds thinly sliced pork shoulder see bulgogi recipe for slicing tips
6 tablespoons gochujang Korean chili pepper paste
1 tablespoon gochugaru Korean chili pepper flakes
Thinly slice the meat, if not pre-sliced.
Mix all marinade ingredients well. Combine the meat, onion, and scallions with the marinade and mix well.

Grill over charcoal or pan fry in a skillet over medium high heat until slightly caramelized. (Preheat and lightly oil with sesame oil before adding the meat. If pan frying, do not crowd the skillet. Adjust the heat as necessary.)
